newsitem.title: CHINA: FAW-Volkswagen China venture makes profit.
newsitem.headline: FAW-Volkswagen China venture makes profit.

text.p: A joint venture between China's First Auto Works and Volkswagen AG of Germany that makes Jetta cars in China has recorded a profit for the first time, Xinhua news agency said on Friday.
The joint venture made an average monthly profit of 32 million yuan ($3.9 million) between January and April, it said.
The venture produced 12,648 Jetta cars in the first four months, up 35.9 percent compared with the year-ago period, Xinhua said.
Sales jumped a year-on-year 41.1 percent to 12,759 units in the first four months, the news agency said. It gave no further details.
First Auto, based in the northeastern city of Changchun, is issuing 300 million A shares for domestic investors in an offer that aims to raise more than two billion yuan.
The company began offering the shares on Thursday. The shares will be listed on China's southern stock exchange of Shenzhen, near Hong Kong, next month.
First Auto would use the funds to expand the now modest production of its Hongqi, or Red Flag, passenger car to reach 90,000 vehicles a year by 2001.
